clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Pediatric Skin Disorders: The "Big" Study
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Pediatric Skin Disorders: The "Big" Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study leverages the availability of a validated series of instruments to measure the effect of highly visible, chronic skin disorders, including atopic dermatitis (AD), on patients 8 years of age and above in causing stigma and psychiatric issues, particularly anxiety and depression.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multi center study with Northwestern University/Lurie Children's Hospital serving as the Data Coordinating Center. Site selection has been completed through members of PeDRA.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure the stigma experienced by children as a function of the child's perceived skin lesion visibility using the altered Neuro-QoL stigma tool
primary_outcome.description: Measure the stigma experienced by children as a function of the child's perceived skin lesion visibility using the altered Neuro-QoL stigma tool

study_pop.textblock: 3,500 parent/child dyads across all sites (at least 50 parent/child dyads at each site).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects must be aged 8-17 years of age
- Subject must be diagnosed with a chronic skin disease deemed to be severe enough and/or in a visible location that could be stigmatizing as determined by the study doctor
- Subject and parent must both be English speaking with at least one parent/guardian who will complete the questionnaires
- Subject and Parent/Guardian must be able to complete the relevant questionnaires
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children under 8 years of age
- Children with developmental delay and/or a behavioral disorder that would preclude participation in form completion
- Children with a non-cutaneous disorder that is considered by the Study doctor to be stigmatizing

facility.name: Department of Dermatology, Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine and Lurie Children's Hospital
